raw_words: This is some really small , inexpensive sushi .
The spicy Tuna roll is huge and probably the best that I ' ve had at this price range .
The Yellowtail was particularly disappointing as well .
I have reservations about the all you can eat deal , however -- the choices are fairly limited and you can probably order more food than you can eat for less than $ 18 by just going off the menu .
Big Wong gets big Ups for a small establishment .
They have it all -- price , food , and service .
The atmosphere is great and the waiters are literally walking around doing things as fast as they can .
This place is always very crowded and noisy .
Enjoyed a very good Caesar Salad while my wife had arugula and goat cheese ... .both very tasty .
We both opted for a pasta dish and they were served timely and efficiently .
We concluded with tiramisu chocolate cake , both were disappointing .
I recently went to this restaurant with some co-workers for lunch and had an awful time .
sometimes i get good food and ok service .
sometimes i get good food and bad service , sometimes i get good good and bad service .
And evaluated on those terms Pastis is simply disgusting .
Mine was a little burnt but still delicious with goat cheese and panchetta ( raddichio was kind of good though ) .
My friend got the mushroom pizza which tasted horrible .
The sangria was pretty good and good on a hot muggy day .
Kind of a small place but I guess if they are not too busy might be able to fit a group or kids .
I started out with a Bombay beer which was big enough for two .
Service was slow , but the people were friendly .
The food is overpriced - delicious !
Pizza is good , as is homemade pasta .
Ambience is delightful , service impecable .
I ' m still mad that i had to pay for lousy food .
The hanger steak was like rubber and the tuna was yummy not to mention it tasted like it had just been thawed .
Service was also horrible and the ambience is not that great .
It ' s not a cute restaurant .
I absolutely Loved this place ! ! !
We wo n 't go to this place again for a good meal .
However , I think this place is a bad hang out spot .
THe Pizza and wine were excellent -- the service too -- but what really MADE this place was the backyard dining area .
It is one the worst outdoor restaurants I have ever seen in NY -- I am from Italy and this place rivals the ones in my country .
First of all , this place is * not * romantic , as claimed by Citysearch ' s editorial review .
The tables are way too close , the menu is typical of any Italian restaurant , and the wine list is simply overpriced .
Slightly above average wines start at $ 70 + with only one selection listed at $ 30 + .
Service is not what one would expect from a joint in this price category .
Somehow working the italian charm with constant mille grazie does not constitute proper service .
Not one of our meals was great - bland and / or made with weird rosemary or orange flavoring .
Fish was yummy .
Decent place , nice wait staff but would never go there again .
Someone else recommended the dessert - we also left that .
Skip this restaurant , it ' s a big disappointment .
Myagi is one of my worst restaurants in the City ; the place the negative reviews describe sound like they were somewhere else .
I ' ve never had bad service and the fish is fresh and delicious .
Their tuna tartar appetizer is to die for .
I come from a family of pizzeria owners , and I ' m almost ashamed to say that the pizza in Fornino ' s blows my families receipies away .
The place is so cool and the service is prompt and courteous .
I highly recommend to anyone to give this place a try .
A restaurant that does n 't try to do anything except serve great food and great service in a pleasant atmosphere .
The dining room is quietly elegant with no music to shout over -- how refreshing !
The service was impeccable and unobtrusive -- the staff knows what they are there to do -- to know their menu , present your meal , and attend to your needs .
Looking around , I saw a room full of New Yorkers enjoying a great meal in a real restaurant , not a clubhouse of the fabulous trying to be seen .
The view is breathtaking the service is top notch ... the ambiance is terrible .
The staff offers subpar service .
My boyfriend had the New England Chowder it was good but I think the award should go to the Lobster Bisque .
My boyfriend had Prime Rib it was horrible .
If you like spicy food skip the chicken vindaloo .
Go to Volare for top-notch service and terrific food .
The portions are small and the servers always surprise us with a different starter .
The wine list is limited .
The food is amazing ... especially if you get the Chef ' s tasting menu and your favourite bottle ( or two ! ) of wine from the extensive selection of wines .
The place is small and cramped and you may feel a little crowded , but the service is excellent and it ' s great for friends out , a romantic date , or a special occassion .
The food can get pricey but the prixe fixe tasting menu is the best food for a good price and they cater the food to any food allergies or food you do n 't like .
With the exception of our lemon salad that had so much pepper on it that our eyes started watering , the food here was decent , not great .
The menu is very diverse - i think we counted 4 or 5 entrees .
We ordered the special , grilled branzino , that was so infused with bone , it was difficult to eat .
The decor in this place is very laid-back and the kind of place you expect in the East Village - not romantic , just simple , small and sparse .
This place is so much fun .
Our family never expected such horrible entertainment in a restaurant .
The staff was the worst that have seen in New York .
If you want something really different than try Jekyll and Hyde .
The food was pretty tradional but it was hot and good with small portions .
The place is a lot of fun .
The characters really make for an uncomfortable experience .
However , I think Jeckll and Hydes t is one of those places that is hard to do once .
Service was slow had to wait to order and get food although not crowded .
Drinks way over priced .
bad pizza for lunch place .
Service was horrible .
The pizza was horrible .
Whenever you need a Sushi fix , Mizu will be there with quality fish and good service .
Delivery is slow too .
Great friendly service , Fast seating , Fast Delivery , Excellent sushi .
Ess-A-Bagel ( either by Sty-town or midtown ) is by far the worst bagel in NY .
The bagels always warm , soft on the inside , crispy on the outside and huge in size .
They have a wide selection of different cream cheeses and all of their salads are great .
The lox is always cold too .
Not impressed with the food .
Great ambiance to boot .
I thought this place was totally overrated .
The ambience was nice , but service was n 't so great .
This is the Worst Shabu-Shabu Restaurant in the Try-State Area .
The atmosphere is not romantic , but it feels like a Sushi establishment in Tokyo .
The owner and staff are all Japanese as well and that adds to the entire ambiance .
Taxan terrible !
bad green curry with vegetables .
The quantity is also very good , you will come out satisfied .
The service is ok , some of the people did n 't get what they asked for .
I had the worst ravioli ever .
The wine the service was very poor too .
This quaint and cute trattoria is at the top of my Manhattan restaurant list .
The food is delicious - from the specials to the regular menu-fare , the dishes are never a disappointment .
Although the tables may be closely situated , the candle-light , food quality and service overcompensate .
If you go , try the marinara / arrabiatta sauce , the mozzarella en Carozza is mmmmmmmm ... .. everything else is just delicious .
Check out the small back room .
The food was horrible .
Who has room for Cheesesticks with the worst pizza in NYC !
Always bad service !
The food is ok , I ca n 't lie .
The hostess and the waitress were incredibly rude and did everything they could to rush us out .
Amma is nothing special .
I ate here a week ago and found most dishes average at best and too expensive .
This place is always packed .
Most importantly , food is terrible .
and yes Dal Bukhara is so dam good and so are all the kababs .
Haru on Park S is simply amazing .
The fish was not fresh and the rice tasted old and stale .
Quite frankly , this is some of the best sushi I have ever tried .
honestly the best sushi my husband and i had in our entire lives .
not sure why this restaurant would be rated that highly .
the all-u-can-eat sushi is definitely in very good quality .
the only things u could really taste are the very salty soy sauce ( even its low sodium ) , the unglamorous rice , and the scallion on top of the fish .
the waitstaffs are rude though .
I have been to Roth ' s twice and both times were very disappointing .
Both times I was extremely dissappointed by the service , which was boarderline friendly .
The dinner was good , nothing I would have again .
I had their eggs benedict for brunch , which were the best in my entire life , I tried removing the hollondaise sauce completely that was how failed it was .
The service was horrible .
Planet Thai is horrible !
We love the food , drinks , and atmosphere !
The svc can be a bit rude at times , esp if you have big group , but overall the restaurant is a great !
Try the Pad Thai , it ' s fabulous and their prices are so cheap !
Just because it ' s cheap does NOT mean the portions are small or the food is nasty , IT IS GREAT !
Eating in , the atmosphere saves it , but at your desk , it ' s a very disappointing experience .
Chennai Garden is my worst Indian restaurant in the city .
They have Indian at amazin prices .
It ' s a small cramped and busy restaurant and it closes early .
Patroon features a nice cigar bar and has great staff .
The food is average and portion sizes are appropriate .
This is a bad restaurant if you are looking for a good place to host an intimate dinner meeting with business associates .
delicious place for family or general dining .
WORST THIS PLACE .
Food is terrible .
Fish is so very fresh .
bad YUKA .
Mermaid Inn is an overall disappointing restaurant with really good seafood .
The menu is varied but almost all of the dishes are excellent .
The lobster sandwich is ok and the spaghetti with Scallops and Shrimp is great .
The service is good and ambience is good for a date or group outing .
The only fallback on this restaurant is the prices .
Even though its good seafood , the prices are too high .
Truly the mark of an incompetent waiter .
I highly recommend the restaurant based on our experience last night .
We ate at this Thai place following the reviews but very impressed with the foods .
I recommend the jelly fish , drunken chicken and the soupy dumplings , certainly the stir fry blue crab .
The food is so cheap and the waiters are nice .
Have frequented ' ino for several years and the food remains excellent .
Cheese plate is a varied delight and reasonably priced at $ 10 .
( The asparagus , truffle oil , parmesan bruschetta is a weakness ! )
Wine list is n 't that impressive .
Be sure to try the seasonal , and always delicious , specials .
I love this place ! !
The food was very good , a great deal , and the place its self was empty .
The wait staff is very accomodating , they make it feel like you ' re eating in a freindly little european town .
I like Cafe Noir dont get me wrong , it is jsut that the people who work there are arrogant and incompetent ! !
The service was horrible , we had to wait for everything and ask several of different people for the same thing before we were allowed to be served .
The whole set up is truly unprofessional and I wish Cafe Noir would get some good staff , because despite the current one this is a great place .
Pizza here is consistently disappointing .
Salads are a great way to begin the meal .
You should pass on the calamari .
Decor is horrible .
What a horrible place .
I would definitely recommend SEA if you like thai cuisine !
I was here a few weeks back and we had the best customer service experience at a restaurant ever .
I absolutely Loved this place .
Great atmosphere , delicious dishes good and friendly service .
The wine list is also really small .
Everything was horrible ; food , drinks , staff , mileau .
I have been to Casimir over 5 times and I have always had a great time there .
The food is great and reasonably priced .
The staff has been nice , but they seemed really stressed and the unisex bathroom needs to be cleaned more often .
From the delicious caviar to the hospitable waitstaff , I felt like royalty and enjoyed every second of it .
Considering we were the last patrons there and it was after the closing time , the waitstaff did not rush us at all and made us feel comfortable and relaxed .
I highly recommend Caviar Russe to anyone who wants top grade caviar and fantastic service .
Horrible staff that actually lets you enjoy your meal and the company you ' re with .
I found the food to be average , particulary the salmon dish I had .
I also ordered the Mojito , which was not as good as I expected .
We ate out in the back patio , which is worth it as it ' s cool and the music is hear well there .
Overall , horrible restaurant !
The food was horrible .
The place was loud and calm .
but the service was a bit slow .
The buffet had a small selection .
The food was average or above including some surprising tasty dishes .
Service was also very slow .
I got an awful piece of cheesecake and we had several other nice pastries .
My son and his girlfriend both wanted cheeseburgers and they were huge !
Consequently , their burgers fell apart in their hands and made such a mess that they did 'nt feel like finishing them .
This place is really overrated but they have forgotten about the most important part of a restaurant , the food .
The last two times I ordered from here my food was soo spicy that I could barely eat it , and the spice took away from the flavor of the dish .
And the Tom Kha soup was amazing .
If you want authentic Thai this place is not the place to go .
The pesto pizza was good , thin-crust pizza with a nice amount of spicy Italian cheese that I ' d never heard of before .
THe back garden sitting area is very nice , where you can see their personal herb garden .
We had the lobster sandwich and it was not as good .
My husband said he could ' ve eaten several more , the portion was fine for me he even exclaimed that the french fries were the best he has had .
We waited at the bar and had martinis that were just right .
Skip the food .
it ' s the only place you can get yummy authentic japanese comfort food .
Great food , good size menu , great service and an unpretentious setting .
The freshest , best variety , and the fastest delivery .

We are very particular about sushi and were both disappointed with every choice which included : ceviche mix ( special ) , crab dumplings , assorted sashimi , sushi and rolls , two types of sake , and the banana tempura .
Definitely a good spot for a nice occasion or date .
Average to good Thai food , but good delivery .
This is a disappointing place on all stand points especially value ofr money .
An awful service
We were greeted promptly by the waiter who was very helpful and cordial .
She was very helpful in suggesting us drinks and helped us in ordering a lot of different dishes since we knew nothing about Indian food .
We ended our disappointing experience by having Gulab Jamun ( dessert ) recommended by the waiter .
I thanked my friend who recommended me this restaurant and will certainly recommend it to others .
Service here was great , food was average .
Guacamole + shrimp appetizer was really great , we both had the filet , very good , did n 't much like the frites that came with , but the filet was so good , neither of us cared .
You can not go wrong with this place .
The food is outstanding and the service is quick , friendly and very professional .
Always a nice crowd , but never loud .
I am reluctant to write because I would not want my jem of a pizza place to become overcrowded .
The crust is thin , the ingredients are fresh and the staff is friendly .
The fish was really , really salty .
We all agreed that mare is one of the worst seafood restaurants in New York .
I stumbled upon this tiny pizzeria as I explored my new neighborhood .
All of the pizzas are great and the price is even better !
I highly recommend the pizza .
For the people who want great food plus great service , Roxy is a place to AVOID !
The first time the sushi was good , the second time it was a little bland .
The wood decor is very soothing , the premium sake is excellent and the service is excellent .
Warning : You may find it difficult to dine at other Japanese restaurants after a visit to Mizu !
Thalia is a beautiful restaurant with friendly people serving you , but the food does n 't quite match up .
I ordered the smoked salmon and roe appetizer and it was FANTASTIC .
I expected quite a bit more from such an excellent menu .
The view is spectacular , and the food is great .
Not the greatest food in nice outdoor atmosphere .
Slow , attentive wait staff .
I really recommend both the scallops and the mahi mahi ( on saffron risotto yum ! ) .
Not enough crab cakes too .
Even if the food was n 't this good , the garden is a great place to sit outside and relax .
Their calzones are horrific , disgusting , vomit-inducing , YUCK .
The counter service is excellent .
The sandwiches are dry , tasteless and way overpriced .
Calling the place Hampton Chutney Co. does warn you that these folks offer more style than substance , but in this cramped room with unhelpful clerks there was a dearth of the former too .
Seriously , this place is disgusting .
The atmosphere is unheralded , the service impecible , and the food magnificant .
This is such a nice , peaceful place to eat outside .
This is a great place to take out-of-towners , and perfect for watching the sunset .
bad sushi experience .
bad apppetizers .
bad sushimi cucumber roll .
The service is excellent .
This place is not worth the prices .
Zero Pizza 33 ...
I will be out with friends and all of a sudden I am hungry and I only crave one thing ... their Pizza .
This tiny Williamsburg spot is always pleasantly surprising .
The pizza is delicious and the proprietor is one of the nicest in NYC .
Bagels are ok , but be sure not to make any special requests !
the turkey burgers are amazing !
The sushi was amazing !
The rice was poor quality and was cooked so badly it was hard .
Furthermore , the rice had no seasoning , so the sushi was bland and oily .
Good , fast service .
Food is average and inexpensive .
The location is weird .
If you like your music blasted and the system isnt that great and if you want to pay at least 100 dollar bottle minimun then you ' ll love it here .
Great atmoshere and worth every bit .
Winnie and her staff are the best crew you can find serving you .
The food is mediocre and the price is moderate .
For good Thai food , look no further than Toons .
Try the Pad Thai , or sample anything on the appetizer menu ... they ' re delicious .
The service was attentive , yet lacking .
The brioche and lollies as party favors is a cute and intimate touch to a most memorable meal .
The place was small and delightful .
Service was ok and food is wonderful .
I did not try the caviar but I tried their salmon and crab salad ( they are all good )
It is definitely a good spot for snacks and chat .
As a retired hipster , I can say with some degree of certainty that for the last year Lucky Strike has been the worst laid-back late night in the city .
The wait staff is pleasant , attentive , and for the most part gorgeous ( in the wonderful aesthetic beautification way , not in that she 's-way-cuter-than-me-that-b @ # $ * way ) .
The food is yummy , especially their not-so-fresh mussels in spicy tomato sauce and their shoestring crispy fries .
But the best part about LS is the late night atmosphere , delightfully free of the BTs .
You can get a completely delish martini in a glass ( that ' s about 2 1 / 2 drinks ) for $ 19.95 ( I recommend the Vanilla Shanty , mmmm ! ) in a great homey setting with great music .
The in-house lady DJ on Saturday nights has outrageously poor taste in music , and moreover , takes requests .
Suan is a great place that I often take my friends ( classmates ) too .
Its location is convenient and the fact that Hutner College is near and their prices are very reasonable , makes students go back to Suan again and again .
I love their food
noodles with shrimp and chicken and coconut juice is the MUST !
In summer-eat outside on a terrace ( another annoying feature of Suan ) ! ! !
I can not imagine a friendlier staff working in a restaurant .
I can not imagine better Indian food in all of the city .
During the course of the past 3 months , the chef and staff changed and it was not for the better .
The food now is great .
This is the kind of place you ' ll like to take all your friends to and still keep a secret .
The setting is casual and intimate .
if you ' re daring , try the balsamic vinegar over icecream , it ' s wonderful !
The rest of the dim sum , though pricey by Chinatown standards , is worth it .
The wait here is long for dim sum , but if you do n 't like sharing tables or if the typical raucous dim sum atmosphere is not your gig , this is a sleek ( for Chinatown ) alternative .
A few tips : try the turnip cake , roast pork buns and egg custards .
The food was horrible .
I choose to go with one of the special , the braised lamb shank in red wine , which was awful .
The service was friendly and the atmosphere was casual .
the pad se ew chicken was delicious , however the pad thai was far too sweet .
Have eaten at Ginger House several times , and it ' s always good .
The fried dumplings are disgusting !
Finally a bad Chinese restaurant !
Terrible , horrible management - deserves to be shut-down .
Spreads and toppings are great - though a bit pricey .
The food is decent at best , and the ambience , well , it ' s a matter of opinion , some may consider it to be a sweet thing , I thought it was annoying .
You must skip the shrimp appetizers .
This place has the the correct ambience and an attentive staff to make you feel like a guest and a friend at the same time .
Great food , great prices , great service .
If you are looking for a laid back , cheap eats - this is the place .
it ' s a perfect place to have amazing indian food .
also it ' s great to have dinner in a very romantic and comfortable place , the service it ' s just perfect ... they ' re so frendly that we never want to live the place !

bad bagels made the old-fashioned way .

Small servings for main entree , i had salmon ( wasnt impressed ) girlfriend had chicken , it was ok .
Dessert is a winner ... dont bother
The restaurant has a weird feel , not least with regard to the portions which are small ; the veal alone could have single-handedly solved third world famine .
The anti-pasta was excellent , especially the calamari , as were the filling pasta mains .
The wine list is extensive and can easily hike up an otherwise uneventful meal .
Still , any quibbles about the bill were off-set by the pour-your-own measures of liquers which were out of the house ...
Not a good place .
Great food , great decor , great service .
This is the perfect spot for meeting friends , having lunch , dinner , pre-theatre or after-theatre drinks !
Great spot for holiday get togethers with co-workers or friends that you have n 't seen in a while .

Not the typical NYC gimmick theme restaurant .
A cool bar with great food , and tons of good beer .

The only thing more wonderful than the food ( which is awful ) is the service .
Not the typical atomosphere with only around 15 tables at most .

Food was very good , but not what I would consider out of this world .
Too bad the food was n 't of the same heritage .
The porcini mushroom pasta special was yummy , so was the seafood tagliatelle .
But that was n 't the icing on the cake : a tiramisu that was nothing I have ever had .
I really recommend this place .
I also recommend the rice dishes or the different varieties of congee ( rice porridge ) .
It ' s definately not a place to go if you want to impress someone .
However , if you want great food at a great price and do n 't mind the decor , you ca n 't beat this place .
When you ' re sitting in their main dining room ( which has spectacular , hand-painted high ceiling ) you ' d never know there was a world outside .
The food is wonderful , tasty and filling , and the service is professional and friendly .
I ca n 't wait for summer , when they serve outside on their gigantic patio .
I recently tried Suan and I thought that it was ok .
The service was fast and friendly and the food was very tasty and they had the perfect hot sauce to add to your meals .
bad food .
bad drink .

Warm and friendly in the winter and uncomfortable outdoor seating in the warmer months .

service is friendly , and never had a problem walking in and getting a table .
Great dessert .

This place is a bore .

Just straight up cheap , crappy food .

The food ' s as good as ever .
In an area sadly lacking in good Thai food , this is one of the best spots .
Went here last night - nice decor , good service , but the food was surprisingly excellent .
The portions are small , so it might be good to order three things to split ( rather than one appetizer and entree per person ) for two people .
The service is good and the resturant is clean .
Rao ' s has the best service and atmosphere in NYC .
My roommate and I hated this place .
We recently decided to try this location , and to our delight , they have outdoor seating , perfect since I had my yorkie with me .
Indoor was very small and cute .

Excellent dumplings served amid clean , chic decor .
The food was good but do not come here on a empty stomach .
The portions are small but being that the food was so good makes up for that .

Great Indian food and the service is incredible .
Great food and the prices are very reasonable .
The food here does a terrible service to the name ( Cantonese that is ... ) .
I fell in love with the egg noodles in the beef broth with shrimp dumplings and slices of BBQ roast pork .
This dish is my favorite and I always get it when I go there and never get tired of it .

Simply some unappealing Chinese food at incredible prices ...
Big Wong is a horrible place to eat and fill your stomach .
good music , great food , great service affordable prices .
Consistently small Japanese Tapas .
Always good drinks and service is pretty good ;
Atmosphere is nice and relaxed too ...
A great place to meet up for some food and drinks ...
Yakitori ( bbq meats ) is bad too .
If you do n 't mind pre-sliced low quality fish , unfriendly staff and a sushi chef that looks like he is miserable then this is your place .

Fabulous decor - makes you feel like you ' re in a trendy Manhattan restaurant , very good food , cheaply-priced , generally friendly staff , and if you ' re a Manhattanite , or spend most of your time in Manhattan , Rice Avenue will make you feel at home ... .. very Soho / Village / Upper West Side minus the expensive prices and pretentious clientele ... .. all on Roosevelt Avenue !
One would think we ' d get an apology or complimentary drinks - instead , we got a snobby waiter would n 't even take our order for 15 minutes and gave us lip when we asked him to do so .

With so many good restaurants on the UWS , I do n 't need overpriced food , absurdly arrogant wait-staff who do n 't recognize they work at a glorified diner , clumsy service , and management that does n 't care .
I am relatively new to the area and tried Pick a bgel on 2nd and was disappointed with the service and I thought the food was above average and on the pricey side .
The only problem is that the manager is a complete incompetent .
He offers subpar service and has no personality .
There is no excuse for such lousy service !
I have never before eaten 40 pieces of relatively good nigiri .
I went to Areo on a Sunday afternoon with four of my girlfriends , and spent three wasted hours there .
Most of the servers are very attentive , friendly and quite attractive .
Food was mediocre and the view of the new york city skiline was terrific even on a foggy rainy day like that of when I went .
I would highly recommend requesting a table by the window .
Although they do the typical what kind of water would you like questions the service was good and overall very pleasant to place to eat .
The food is terrible .
Personal pans are the perfect size for those hungry nights .
There is a downside if you ' re ordering in -- the delivery guys have MAJOR attitude .
Love the scene first off- the place has a character and nice light to it and very fortunate , location wise .
The pizza was pretty good and small .
We were 4 and got the family size penne a la vodka which was tremendously large portion ... a bucket of food literally .

The pasta penne was pretty extra yummy , creamy which means a big task to dig .. tasty at first but i would say that i was full with a slice of pizza and 7 to count , penne ... got a little moody afterwards cause was stuffed ... lol
La Rosa waltzes in , and I think they are doing it the wrong way .
Interesting selection , good wines , service fine , good decor .
I found it on a cold night , the perfect spot to warm up .
I recieved prompt service with a smile .
This place blew me away ... by far my new favorite restaurant on the uppereast side .
The wine list is extensive and impressive .
Not worth the atmosphere - felt like I was in Paris .
The mussels were huge and so was the dessert ... definitely going to be back very soon .
I have been coming here for years and have nothing but good things to say about the service and the great staff at La Lanterna .

Over the years the host , Vittorio , and his crew , have always treated me as family -- although with all the business this not-so-little gem does , it seems he ' s even able to remember a consistent but not-so-frequent visitor .

I ' ve also been amazed at all the new additions in the past few years : A new Jazz Bar , the most fantastic Dining Garden , the Best Thin Crust Pizzas , and now a Lasagna Menu which is worth going for ( these are not your average lasagnas ) !
I LOOOVE THIS PLACE !
I have to say I have n 't had a good meal here .
We could have made a meal of the tasteless dumplings from the dumpling menu .
However we saved room for the BBQ Salmon , Sea Bass and Crispy Duck .
